item.title: Refactoring yt Frontends - Part 3
item.description: Welcome to part 3 of a series on how yt deals with data and the ways that helps and hinders things! This time, I am going to describe what “chunks” of data (YTDataChunk) in yt are, and a few characteristics of them that wouldn’t be obvious from the previous blog posts. Chunks have spatial attributes Data chunks in yt have a set of special attributes that help yt to put them in the context of the coordinate domain.

item.title: Refactoring yt Frontends - Part 2
item.description: SIDE NOTE: I intended for this blog post to be a bit shorter than it turned out, and for it to cover some things it … didn’t! So it looks like there’ll be a part three in the series. Operations on Data Objects In my previous post, I walked through a few aspects of how the chunking system in yt works, mostly focusing on the "io" style of chunking, where the order in which data arrives is not important.

item.title: Refactoring yt Frontends - Part 1
item.description: The first post in a deep dive into yt frontends, chunking, and why and how they might be refactored.
